rComments: Pranav is a great teacher and the material is interesting. It can get tough, but it's satisfying work.

I really am not into the whole linguistics aspect of my major but after taking a class w/ Pranav I can't wait to take another! He makes sure to go at a pace everyone is comfortable w/ & always makes sure to ask if anyone needs clarification. He literally teaches you the basics so you learn step by step.Great enthusiasm&personality during lectures

Funny, helpful. Really makes you think for yourself which means some hw problems can get confusing because he introduces new concepts so that you can use your intuitions. Do all your assignments and go to office hours if needed and you should be good in the class. Take home midterms and finals plus no textbook = thumbs up.

I took Semantics I, II, and Language and Cognition with Pranav. He's the greatest!  Crystal clear, interesting, and his expectations are entirely reasonable.  Do what you're supposed to and you'll get a good grade!

Pranav is hands down the best ling. teacher at UCSC. If you are dedicated, go to lecture, and pay attention, you will learn so much from him. Incredibly intelligent. Genuinely wants his students to understand. Encourages students to come to their own conclusions in class. I recommend any and all classes taught by Pranav. A++++++

Semantics II is hard. It should be. As a grad student now, I still reference the notes from Pranav's class. Keep your notes and the articles...you'll reread them countless times and FINALLY (I'm not a semanticist, by any means)you'll understand.  I found him totally accessible and eager to encourage...talk to him, you'll do well.
I took Semantics I with him, having previously taking the intro to linguistics class.  He is extremely passionate and helpful.  A wonderful professor who keeps it interesting.

He seems sweet at first, but he must have been going through a hard quarter. He reprimands us for not asking questions, but whenever anyone asks a question he shouts and belittles them. If soemthing is unclear and someone asks for clarification, he repeats the same thing except in a louder voice.

This guy is so ridiculous. He entertains the class' inane "what ifs" for the entire class until he realizes he didnt get through any lecture and then rushes through it. His homework and tests are (ironically) unclear and ambiguous, and i feel that the subject would be much easier if i had a different prof who knew how to teach.

Yes, Pranav is very demanding. But if you're a ling major, you should know better. Just suck it up and do your work, and the class will prove extremely rewarding. Pranav definitely knows his semantics, so you're learning from the master himself.
Very clear lecturer, but can be a little rude. Hard homeworks, and not much in the way of help.
